definition: to appear before one's eyes/pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
(idiom) to greet the eye/to come into view

sentences.english: The sight that met my eyes made it hard to keep a straight face.
sentences.chinese: 映入眼簾的情景使我難以板起面孔。

sentences.english: The first thing to catch your sight is the neatly arranged desks in the middle.
sentences.chinese: 首先映入眼簾的是中間排列整齊的書桌。

sentences.english: As soon as you enter in Wuhan, the greenery catches your eye.
sentences.chinese: 當你來到武漢，映入眼簾的是青枝綠葉。

sentences.english: Please don't apply it on impaired skin and avoid entering eyes.
sentences.chinese: 請勿塗於皮膚破損處，防止入眼。

sentences.english: Can lathery pleasant to see reduce vision?
sentences.chinese: 肥皂泡入眼會降低視力嗎？

sentences.english: The world with eyes, human heart.
Near, sit at the mountain road, chrysanthemum rob fields of contact with eyes, aromatic infinite.
sentences.chinese: 靠近，坐在山路邊，四野菊花搶入眼，芳香無限。

sentences.english: Stroilling along the red ancient city walls of Leshan, the picturesque city and countryside views came to your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 沿着樂山紅色的古城牆而行，半壁如畫江山入眼來。

sentences.english: Hardly had I got to Elland Road, when the stadium came into my vision.
sentences.chinese: 剛一踏上埃蘭路，不遠處的球場就映入眼簾。

sentences.english: He overlooked the land， which was still a vast expanse of whiteness. Suddenly， a leaden object jumped into his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一個深灰色的物體映入眼簾。

sentences.english: In the vast expanses of the Gobi desert, the straight highway never ends.
sentences.chinese: 茫茫的戈壁映入眼簾，與天相接與地同廣。

sentences.english: Perhaps the wind. Let acid, suddenly burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 線也許是山中酸風入眼，讓人突然地淚流滿面。

sentences.english: King eyes, all ears, insights into the heart.
sentences.chinese: 煙景入眼，萬籟入耳，感悟入心。

sentences.english: The tall stairway is the first identification space when entering the L house.
sentences.chinese: 當你進入到L住宅時，通高的樓梯空間首先映入眼簾。

sentences.english: The light fragrance strikes, on Shannon south line, a pool of water view.
sentences.chinese: 淡淡的花香襲來，循香南行，一池清水映入眼簾。

sentences.english: Dan-back was strange hand, had a few pleasant to the eye his life.
sentences.chinese: 歸來卻怪丹青手，入眼平生幾曾有。

definition: eye-catching/conspicuous/obtrusive/striking/sticking out
(idiom) to greet the eye/to come into view
to appear before (one's eyes)/to come to (one's mind)
eyes (in literature)/eyesight
fills the eyes (of a beautiful view, scene of desolation etc)
(of tears etc) filling the eyes/(of scenery etc) filling one's field of view
to look/to raise one's eyes
to peer/to scan/to examine carefully
to be full of/completely
nearby
variant of 黑糊糊[hei1 hu1 hu1]
in a mess/scattered about/in complete disorder
(of mist, snow, floodwater etc) a vast expanse of whiteness
to espy/to spot
to look around
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
